recipe.ingredients: - green lentils: 1 cup - water: 3 cups - cucumber (diced): 1 medium - red onion (finely chopped): 1 small - cherry tomatoes (halved): 1 cup - parsley (chopped): 1/4 cup - lemon juice: 1/4 cup - olive oil: 3 tablespoons - garlic (minced): 2 cloves - Dijon mustard: 1 teaspoon - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Cook Lentils: Rinse the lentils under cold water. In a medium saucepan, bring 3 cups of water to a boil. Add lentils, reduce heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes until lentils are tender but not mushy. Drain any excess water and allow to cool. 2. Prepare Vegetables: In a large bowl, combine the cooled lentils, diced cucumber, chopped red onion, halved cherry tomatoes, and chopped parsley. 3. Make Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, Dijon mustard, salt, and black pepper. 4. Combine: Pour the dressing over the lentil and vegetable mixture and toss to coat evenly. 5. Chill and Serve: Refrigerate the salad for about 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Serve chilled.
